column4: hey all, I am sshed into a machine that is running as a desktop..  I am trying to remote reboot (as sudo), it says it is rebooting but never does
does you terminal still respond to the keyboard?
yep
try "sudo -i" first
sudo -i does the same
if I try shutdown -r now that reboots right?
I will try it, I just want to make sure if I succeed it comes back on :)
that is important.  "sudo -i" is another way to get root access.
read the man... yeah it is the same, sorry
did "reboot" work?
nope, not as sudo, not as root. shutdown -r now also did not work in either case
is there a place in the logs I might find the error?
no other ideas?
no.
okay, I will keep digging, cheers for trying :)
I find pinging the host helpfull to know when it comes up, but be careful you aren't ping the DSL modem.
it lives!
I hve autossh setup so it calls me back :)
great what fixed it?
kahen: the solution totally sucks but worked :) http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=5193&page=3
I tried the last thing, then called /etc/init.d/reboot stop and voila
